skill.description: Auto-invoke when reviewing API routes, server logic, Express/Node.js code, or backend architecture. Enforces REST conventions, middleware patterns, and separation of concerns.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides backend development guidelines and best practices. It contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no environment variable access. The skill is purely instructional content that helps developers review backend code quality.

content.user_title: Review backend code for API best practices
content.value_statement: Backend code reviews often miss critical security and design issues. This skill automatically checks your Express routes, middleware, and API endpoints against industry best practices.
actual_capabilities: Checks RESTful API conventions and HTTP methods
Validates proper error handling and status codes
Reviews separation of concerns between layers
Identifies security vulnerabilities in route handlers
Provides HTTP status code reference guide
limitations: Requires manual review for business logic errors

use_cases.title: Learn backend best practices
use_cases.description: Get instant feedback on API design, error handling, and architecture patterns while learning backend development fundamentals.

use_cases.title: Standardize code reviews
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent backend code quality across your team with automated checks for REST conventions and security patterns.

use_cases.title: Onboard new team members
use_cases.description: Provide structured guidance for backend development standards and catch common mistakes before they reach production.

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these Express routes for REST conventions, error handling, and separation of concerns: [paste your route code]

prompt_templates.title: Authentication Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if these API endpoints have proper authentication and authorization. Are sensitive routes protected? [paste your auth code]

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this backend code for error handling. Are errors properly caught, logged, and returned to clients? [paste your error handling code]

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this backend architecture for separation of concerns. Should business logic be moved to services? Are routes too fat? [describe your architecture]

best_practices: Always validate input before processing requests
Use proper HTTP status codes for all responses
Keep routes thin - move logic to controllers/services
Never expose internal errors or stack traces to clients
anti_patterns: Putting business logic directly in route handlers
Using verbs in API endpoint names (/getUsers)
Returning 200 OK with error messages in body
Exposing database errors or stack traces to API clients

faq.question: Which backend frameworks does this support?
faq.answer: Primarily Express.js, but principles apply to Fastify, Hono, and other Node.js frameworks.

faq.question: Can it detect SQL injection vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: It identifies patterns like string concatenation in queries and suggests parameterized queries.

faq.question: Does it work with non-Node.js backends?
faq.answer: REST principles are universal, but examples focus on JavaScript/TypeScript implementations.

faq.question: How does it handle file uploads?
faq.answer: Reviews validation, size limits, and security headers for multipart form data endpoints.

faq.question: Can it suggest pagination implementations?
faq.answer: Yes, it flags missing pagination on list endpoints and suggests cursor or offset patterns.

faq.question: Does it check for rate limiting?
faq.answer: It identifies endpoints that should have rate limiting based on their purpose and suggests implementation.
